  • Development »

Core¶

maker is at the heart of the project. It provides a set of generic models, such as Object, which is extended by many other entities in Maker.

The Core also handles automatic module insertion and provides many routines for module manipulation.

Models¶

maker Core system objects

class maker.core.models.IntegrationResource(nuvius_id, resource_id, resource_name, services='', role='slave')[source]¶

Resource set for integration via Nuvius

nuvius_id = <ID of the user on Nuvius (may be obtained via JSONP call> resource_id = <Application ID, i.e. 1 for Facebook> resource_name = <Application name, i.e. Google Contacts> services = <Data points ID on Nuvius, e.g. for /services/news/ ID is 37rw to read/write> role = <Usually master or slave>

nuvius_id = 0¶
resource_id = 0¶
resource_name = ''¶
role = 'slave'¶
service = ''¶

maker.core.views.save_upload(uploaded, filename, raw_data)[source]¶

raw_data: if True, uploaded is an HttpRequest object with the file being the raw post data if False, uploaded has been submitted via the basic form submission and is a regular Django UploadedFile in request.FILES
